pros: Many wonderful people work at CSI and there can be a great sense of camaraderie and community there.
cons:
Upper management is run like a cult of personality. Dissent is not just unwelcome, it is punished. Workers who express critical opinions are branded as troublemakers and once this happens they will find it hard to achieve any sort of progress within the organization -- both in terms of their career advancement and in terms of advancing ideas to improve the organization. 
On top of all of this, there are organizational pressures to be available outside of working hours, especially when it comes to social events like staff parties and retreats. Not everyone feels safe at these events, in part because of the heavy drinking that occurs. Calls for healthy, professional boundaries are often met with derision -- after all, one of the team's core value is that we "ride or die together," a value that can easily be mobilized to stifle dissent.

pros:
I was reading an article recently that outlined the results of years of research about what makes a good team. The found that the most important thing was psychological safety, define like this:

"Psychological safety means a shared belief that the team is safe for interpersonal risk-taking. It is also a sense of confidence that the team will not embarrass, reject or punish someone for speaking up. It describes a team climate characterized by interpersonal trust and mutual respect in which people are comfortable being themselves."

To me that is what it is like here.
cons: There are a lot of big ideas flying around so you have to be a bit protective of your time and energy.
